required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Marginal Bone Height Changes Around Two Different Surface Treated Dental Implants Supporting Mandibular Complete Overdenture.
clinical_study.official_title: Marginal Bone Height Changes Around Two Different Surface Treated Dental Implants Supporting Mandibular Complete Overdenture.

brief_summary.textblock: Patients participating in this study were rehabilitated by mucosa supported maxillary complete denture and mandibular overdenture supported by two different surface treated implants; resorbable blast media (RBM) on the right and Acid etched on the left; retained by ball attachments. The marginal bone height changes around RBM and acid etched surface treated dental implants retaining mandibular complete overdenture were assessed by cone beam computed tomography.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Ten completely edentulous patients aged from 50-60 years

primary_outcome.description: The marginal bone changes around each type of dental implant were assessed by cone beam computed tomography.

clinical_study.condition: Assess Marginal Bone Height Changes Around Dental Implants

intervention.description: Resorbable blast media surface treated dental implant and Acid etched surface treated dental implant.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Free from any systemic diseases affecting the bone metabolism.
- Healthy, firm covering mucosa which is free from any signs of Inflammation or ulceration.
- Residual alveolar ridge with adequate height and width.
- Angel's class I classification maxillo - mandibular relationship.
- Sufficient inter arch space
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smoker.
- Patients with parafunction habits (clenching or bruxism).
